name: Osman Addresses the Council
description: A special session of the Princely Council has been planned, and it is expected that the gathered Princes will present a plethora of reforms to the Nizam - reforms that are likely intended to put more power in their hands, and perhaps even open up positions on the council to those outside the aristocracy. It is a bold plan, though some are nervous as to whether the Nizam will agree.

name: Refuse Proposed Reforms
description: The Nizam outright rejects the proposed reforms, putting the Princely Federation onto the path of autocracy and perhaps even outright rebellion by disaffected Princely States.

name: Dissolve the Council
description: The Princely Council serves no purpose in a modern state, and authority should rest solely in the hands of the Nizam. This declaration will, almost assuredly, lead to open rebellion.

name: Appoint National Diwan
description: Replacing the Council of Princes will require the appointment of a national diwan, a prime minister who will serve at the Nizam's pleasure. This will continue the re-organisation of the government into a lean and autocratic organisation.

name: Declare the Kaisar-i-Hind
description: With the Nizam firmly in control, the time has come to declare a change: the Princely Federation will heretofore be known as the Indian Empire, and Osman its Kaisar-i-Hind! All power will rest with him, and the people will cheer as one their champion who has promised to regain control of the sub-continent under the only true banner of its culture.

name: Father of the Federation
description: While some might have assumed the Nizam held imperial ambitions, the truth is that he intended solely to centralise the government's power in his hands for the benefit of all. With the princes no longer able to slow the nation's growth with their in-fighting, the time has come for the Federation to take back what it has lost.

name: Agree to Proposed Reforms
description: The Nizam has accepted the Princely Council's plan, though there remains a question as to just how far the intended reforms will go. Some are expressing concern that the Nizam may intend to go even further than the princes desire, setting up the nation for a possibly democratic future.

name: The New Council of Princes
description: The details on the reforms to the council have been decided - and its power will largely be transferred to a national diwan who serves at the behest of the Nizam. The Princely States appear pleased with this result, though there remains a question as to whether only a prince can serve as diwan or whether the position will be opened to a popular election.

name: Hold Free Elections
description: The position of diwan will be opened up to a national election, and the requirements for serving on the national council will be loosened. Not all the princes are especially pleased with this result, but the people will rejoice at this new embracing of democracy.

name: Unite the Princes
description: The position of diwan will be restricted solely to the princes themselves, with their agreement that reforms will continue to organise and centralise the government.

name: A New Federation!
description: Finally the reforms have been completed! The government's power has been centralised, and the princes united in their desire to see the Federation retake the rest of the sub-continent and restore it to independence and prosperity!

name: Align with Germany
description: Now that India has been re-united, we must consider approaching Germany and becoming part of its faction. Their interests are our interests.

name: Align with Russia
description: Russia has always desired to extend its rule southward, such is the nature of their Great Game. Perhaps it is best to be their friend, rather than their enemy.

name: Align with Japan
description: Japan's ambitions lie in control over all of Asia. Let us align with them, and we shall control it together!

name: Splendid Isolation
description: Our place is not to involve ourselves in the struggles of the world. We have re-united our nation - that is enough.

name: An Age of Reason
description: Some traditions keep our nation from achieving its potential - we must pass reforms to prepare it to enter the 20th Century in full.

name: Found the School of Research
description: Founding an academy and making it the centre of advanced research in the nation will do a great deal towards achieving our future goals.

name: Electronics Focus
description: A new age of computers is dawning upon us - we must explore what it represents and how it can benefit us.

name: Radar Focus
description: We have a long coastline, and there are far too many ways for us to be attacked from the sea. We must keep a watchful eye for attackers, and do so with new technology.

name: Expand Research Capability
description: With the revamping of our economy and infrastructure, we are prepared to vault into the future and vastly expand our research capabilities.

name: New Construction Methods
description: To be truthful, many of the Federation's construction methods date back to ancient times. They are tried and true, yes, but if we are to embark upon a period of revitalisation we must use methods that far exceed anything we were capable of previously.

name: The Hyderabad-Deccan Railroad
description: A network of railroads extending from Hyderabad all the way to the southern tip of the continent is just what's needed to revitalise our nation and prepare it for real industrialisation.

name: The Railroad Reaches Mysore
description: The next stage of the railroad's construction: an extension from Hyderabad to the southern city of Mysore.

name: The Railroad Reaches Cape Comorin
description: The last stage of the railroad's construction: an extension from Mysore down to the southern city of Trivandrum.

name: New Economic Reforms
description: We will never achieve true advancement without reforming the laws governing our economy - there are new technologies and opportunities in the world, and we must embrace them.

name: Seek Foreign Investment
description: There is only one way to turn the Federation from a backwater nation into one that strides boldly into the future, and that is by attracting foreign investors to establish new businesses.

name: Expand Civilian Industry
description: We are finally in a position to industrialise, and we must start by expanding our factories.

name: Expand Civilian Industry Further
description: We must continue the expansion of our civilian factories.

name: Expand Military Industry
description: In order to retake the sub-continent, we will need to massively expand our military capacity.

name: Expand Military Industry Further
description: We must continue the expansion of our military factories.

name: Expand Mining Capacity
description: There yet remain resources untapped in the Federation, and we must embrace new methods in order to properly exploit them.

name: The Hyderabad Refinery
description: Our nation is not rich in oil, and thus a massive investment is required to build a modern refinery in the capital. This will be a signal that we are truly an industrial power with which to reckon.

name: The New Economy
description: At long last, we have put our reputation as a backwater aside and may now truly claim to be a rising industrial power, ready to take on our enemies.

name: Expand the Deccan Air Force
description: The Deccan Air Force must expand if it is to rule the skies - which is the only way we can hope to defeat our enemies.

name: Fighter Focus
description: We must advance our knowledge of new fighters and air combat technology.

name: Bomber Focus
description: The development of greater bomber capability is how we will cripple our enemies from the skies.

name: CAS Focus
description: We must expand our air force's ability to support the army from the skies.

name: Rule the Federation's Skies
description: Now that we have the technology, we must increase our capacity and begin putting planes on our airfields.

name: Found Naval Academy
description: We cannot begin to think of building a navy unless we establish a proper naval academy to train new captains and embrace foreign methods of naval combat.

name: Expand Dockyards
description: We must expand our ability to build ships, to truly protect our shores.

name: Expand Dockyards Further
description: We must continue the expansion of our shipbuilding facilities.

name: Small Navy Focus
description: The Federation will never have a powerful navy, and thus we must focus on a small and efficient fleet designed for defence and the protection of our trade vessels.

name: Defend Our Waters
description: The advancement of destroyer technology is our best option for defending our coasts from assault.

name: Ambitious Navy Focus
description: They say we cannot build a powerful navy, and we intend to prove them wrong. Given time, we can rule the waters around India, and that is how we will retake it.

name: The Princely Marine Corps
description: Ruling the waters is only the first step - we must also prepare to attack from the sea, to confuse our enemies and assault them behind the front lines.

name: Initiate Army Reforms
description: Our army is in poor shape, cobbled together from the forces of the various Princely States - none of whom are accustomed to working together. We must begin efforts to unite them towards our common goal.

name: Centralise the Army's Command
description: Command of the armies must be taken out of the hands of the princes and centralised in a small group of commanders. This is the only efficient way, though it will take time to make the princes realise it.

name: Modernise the Razakars
description: The Razakars are Hyderabad's most feared armed force, even though their weapons are severely dated. We must make strides to modernise their equipment.

name: Continue Modernising the Razakars
description: We must continue the modernisation of the Razakars' weaponry and equipment.

name: Expand Hyderabadi Motorworks
description: A heavy investment into the motorworks companies of the capital will ensure we are able to supply our forces with greater mobilisation and, in time, even tanks.

name: Mobilise the Razakars
description: The day of riding horses and marching on foot are a thing of the past - the future of warfare means an armed force capable of moving faster than one's opponent.

name: The Princely Armoured Corps
description: Tank warfare is where our future lies - we must establish the Princely Armoured Corps, and make it the most feared part of our army.

name: Expand the Princely Armoured Corps
description: The technology of our armoured forces must advance.

name: Complete the Army Reforms
description: It has taken time, but our reforms have now completed and our armed forces fully centralised. We are now ready to move the fight to our enemies.

name: Modern Artillery Focus
description: The Federation's artillery mostly dates from the Weltkrieg. We must modernise our artillery unless we wish our soldiers to be eviscerated without proper support.

name: An Army of Princely States
description: Working with the princes to make their common command of the army more efficient, but still respecting their rights, is the best way to keep morale high and maintain national unity.

name: Expand the Princely Cavalry Regiment
description: Cavalry is the traditional focus of our Princely States - and while there are some who say its time has passed, we disagree. Their equipment dates from the Weltkrieg, however, and that must change.

name: Mobility Focus
description: Horses are not the only way to move an armed force. We must supply our armies with the means to overtake our enemy's lines with their sheer speed.

name: Modernise the Deccan Infantry
description: The Deccan Infantry is a venerable force, but its weaponry desperately needs updating if we are to keep up with our enemies.

name: Continue Modernising the Deccan Infantry
description: The modernisation of the Deccan Infantry's weaponry must continue.

name: Expand Support Capacity
description: Our focus must be on expanding the support capacity of the Deccan Infantry. We must make them more efficient, rather than rely solely on brute strength to see us through the coming conflict.

name: A Flexible Command Structure
description: We must gather together our princes and generals, and work towards expanding our planning capability. Better planning and more modern methods are the only way we will expend our strength wisely.

name: Preparing for the Final Struggle
description: It is inevitable that we will face both the Bharatiya Commune and the Dominion of Delhi at some point in the near future. We should ensure we are as strong as possible before proceeding.

name: Fortify the Northern Border
description: Our first order of business in the coming war is to secure our northern border. Only from a proper line of fortresses can we strike our against the Dominion.

name: Fortify the Eastern Border
description: Our first order of business in the coming war is to secure our eastern border. Only from a proper line of fortresses can we strike our against the Commune.

name: Traitors of the North
description: After some deliberation, we have determined our target should be the Dominion of Delhi. Agents have been dispatched to ensure we have the most up-to-date information on their strength.

name: Incite Kashmir to Rebellion
description: There is a possibility that we could entice the princes of Kashmir and Jammu to join our war against the Dominion. It would split the strength of our enemy, though there is a risk our plans could be exposed and our war efforts severely compromised before the war even begins.

name: Fight for Delhi
description: The northern states are rightfully a part of India, and we must fight to regain them.

name: Syndicalists of the East
description: After some deliberation, we have determined our target should be the Bharatiya Commune. Agents have been dispatched to ensure we have the most up-to-date information on their strength.

name: A Pact with the North
description: The Commune is strong enough on its own. Fighting a two-front war would lead to chaos. Perhaps the Dominion of Delhi would agree to a pact? We attack the Commune together, and then determine who shall rule India afterwards. Even if we lose the war that follows, at least we will never be ruled by syndicalist scum.

name: Incite Orissa to Rebellion
description: There is a possibility that we could entice the Zamindar squatters of Orissa to join our war against the Commune. It would split the strength of our enemy, though there is a risk our plans could be exposed and our war efforts severely compromised before the war even begins.

name: Fight for Calcutta
description: The eastern states are rightfully a part of India, and we must fight to regain them.

name: India United!
description: Jai Hind! The subcontinent is once again ours! Now what?

name: Dealing with Bhutan
description: With our control over the India Subcontinent secure, it is time to look to our northern border. New great powers are rising in China, and we must secure our control over the Bhutanese kingdom as a buffer state in the Himalayas. They will act as the shield against Chinese incursions, whether they like it or not.

name: Our Claims Against Nepal
description: Nepal expanded into the Indian lowlands in the chaos following the Weltkrieg. It is time to reassert our domain over those territories.

name: The Deccan States
description: The nations of southern India must either join India willingly or be conquered - the choice is theirs.

name: Claim Ceylon
description: By rights, Ceylon, the Maldives and the Andaman Islands are part of our nation's rightful territory. Their colonialism must come to an end.

name: Claim Goa
description: The enclave of Goa is nothing more than a burr on the side of our proud nation. It is rightfully our territory, and must be returned.

name: Incorporating Burma
description: The eastern realm of Burma was once part of the Raj, and the time has come to incorporate it into our expanding realm.

name: The Burmese Territories in Siam
description: The Siamese Kingdom was one of the more opportunistic of the 'Vulture States' that exploited the disorder of the Raj's demise. With the young Burmese nation hard-pressed by the socialist uprisings in Assam and Bengal, the government of Siam simply occupied several districts and prefectures, including the city of Moulmein - mentioned in Kipling's famous poem. These lands must be returned!

name: The New India Act
description: With common rule over the conquered territories established, the time has come to pass reforms to ensure all of India works together as we stride into the future.

name: Indian Cinema: Propaganda Machine?
description: The vibrant Indian cinema scene has the possibility to be a powerful tool of the state, and while movies are still mainly a toy of the rich, they have wide reaching social effects.

name: The Great Leap Forward
description: With the power of the entire sub-continent united, we can gather together the finest minds of India and match the research capabilities of even the most advanced Western nations!

name: The Delhi Government's Officer Corps
description: The first order of business is dealing with the officers of the defeated Dominion of India. Do we give them a place in our nation? Or retire them before they can make further trouble?

name: Fate of the Loyalist Princely States
description: The northern territories hold a large number of Princely States who joined the traitors. We must decide their fate, and determine how our rule over their territory will proceed.

name: Restructuring the Northern Provinces
description: The Dominion of Delhi granted its citizenry a large number of personal rights. We must determine how to address their change in status, or face even more resistance to our rule.

name: Socialist India's Officer Corps
description: The first order of business is dealing with the officers of the defeated Bharatiya Commune. Do we give these socialists a place in our nation? Or retire them before they can make further trouble?

name: The Question of Industry
description: The Bharatiya Commune relied on nationalised industry, and its business leaders are now turning to us to answer the question regarding what they should do now - the answer for which will determine just how easy it will be for us to pacify the Commune's former heartland.

name: Fate of Assam's Tea Plantations
description: The vast tea plantations of Assam have functioned as state owned entities until the downfall of their socialist rulers. Now they are suffering, and we must settle the question of what is to be done with them if we are to solidify our rule over the region.

name: Fate of the Zamindar Squatters
description: There are a large number of exiled princes who wish to resume their estates in Orissa, now that the socialists have been defeated. Doing so will, however, mean evicting those who have taken over their lands. The question will need to be settled if we are to solidify our rule over the region.
